page.title: 08Local Characters
page.content: As our headteacher retires this year, he is the focus of our attention. He has lived most of his life in this area and has been at Hallam Middle School since 1966. He served in the Royal Navy during the war, as a wireless operator, and was trained as a teacher at the end of the war. He took over at Hallam in 1966 after the school had been open just 18 months and has been here ever since. In that time, the school grew so rapidly that a separate First School had to be built and the Middle School moved into their vacated premises. In 1978 there were 16 classes in the Middle School, with 4 classes accommodated in mobile outbuildings. By 1985, the school has shrunk to nine classes because of the fall in birth rate.
